name: Hotel Splendido and Splendido Mare by Orient Express

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had reservations for lunch at Hotel Splendido knowing we would have a day in Portofino while on a cruise. It is, indeed, a beautiful place. However, we had terrible service and little consideration on their part for mistakes. After our first courses, the waiter brought my husband another plate of the same dish he'd just eaten as his second course. After a minute, someone else took it away and a brusque "sorry, confusion" from the main waiter, we waited a good 20 or more minutes for the correct fish dish to be served. Meanwhile, I went ahead and ate my dish - there was no offer that would allow me to do otherwise. So, my husband sat without food while I ate. When he was finally served, the waitstaff let my plate sit empty on the table while my husband ate (trying to make it look less obvious?) Later, we finally had to ask for the check, for which we then waited another 10-15 minutes. For 3 glasses of wine, a bottle of water, a salad, 2 pasta dishes and a fish dish, the bill was 177 Euros ($220). Amazingly, included in this is a "Coperto" charge of 15 Euros - which is ostensibly the "cover" or, what is often called a "Bread" charge (usually 1 or 2 euros in other cafes and trattorias). The quality of the food was good, however no better than most restaurants we frequent. The service for a restaurant of this reputation was horrendous. If you think paying this much for the view is worth what they charge, you may enjoy Splendido.
reviews.title: Disappointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotel experiences I have had in all my travels. And "experience" is the key, everything at this hotel works so beautifully together, I felt as though I was walking around the set of a romantic movie with every detail in place. The physical building is charming and romantic. The view from the rooms (as well as the dining terrace) is absolute perfection. Looking onto the the entrance to the port of Portofino with a spectacular rock outcrop with the historic Castel Brown perched regally on top. Charming room with THE best bathroom amenity tray I have seen in a hotel. (Even better than the Burj Al Arab) And of course even with this beautiful hotel and the fantastic view, it could all be ruined by bad service, BUT Everyone we encountered was so polite. They are not robots, but genuine fun truly engaging and elegant, all with unique and interesting character. The FANTASTIC concierge team who were all warm and very competent providing excellent information as well as well as the feeling that we would be well taken care of with not a worry. The dining and bar staff, so very efficient on top of being charming and elegant. A memorable moment was spending an evening in the piano lounge area with one of the most enjoyable entertainers I have had the pleasure to see. We sat with many other couples not talking but enthralled with his songs and very fun and creative patter. He was a character right out of a classic movie. ALL the people who work at that hotel have be trained to perfection and were a joy to encounter in a world where that kind of service seems to be disappearing.
reviews.title: Like Being In A Magical Movie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It really was all so well done. Beautiful pool as well with those same magnificent views, and luckily a great little gym.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with great Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read some review on here prior to going and had hesitations, but after staying there 5 nights I know those other people must have had some sort of axe to grind and are just paining a bad picture because they were personally discontent. I too was hesitant about the prime price, but after having a memorable and stay with nothing to even think to complain about I felt glad that I was able to spend my hard earned money to stay in such a perfect hotel. (and I will have to review some of the hotels I don't like to prove the Splendido is a standout, but I tend to want to forget the bad or average ones, this hotel got me excited enough to write this review hoping it will help others go if they are looking for a memorable stay) And it's just a short walk down the hill along a path and in minutes you are in the harbor of Portofino and it's restaurants.
reviews.title: Lived up to its name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel, but you really need to go for the view room. Else the price would be too high. As it was raining during most of our visit, he wife and I spent most of our time out on the balcony that over look the sea. Simply amazing.
reviews.title: Splendid romantic hotel in a romantic seaside setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A really nice traditional property, stunning views over Portofino. The only way to do Portofino. The best thing was the wonderful terrace and outdoor dining. Food was delicious, both at breakfast and dinner, service was good too. Option to dine at Splendido Mare in town was also great. Nice pool, very relaxing to float in the salt water. Generally staff were very friendly. I found the hotel and clientele slightly too old-fashioned and staid however, e.g. the room decor befits a 5 star hotel of the 1990s and the fitness and gym area is small and spartan.
reviews.title: Classic 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Portofino has a lot of hotels and many with beautiful views of the Mediterranean. But the Hotel Splendido is unique in its service and atmosphere. It feels like a hotel from the olden days where guests are part of the community. The service is discreet and efficient. The lunches and dinners are wonderful. Have a drink at the bar after dinner and you'll enjoy some live piano music and singing. Guests join in on the singing. The rooms are spacious and quiet. There is a tennis court on the property. The shuttle runs every 20 minutes or so to the village of Porfofino when we were there (October). Some of the best views are from the pool side.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013
reviews.text: Went on our honeymoon and the staff was fantastic! We got an upgrade to the junior suite... The views everywhere you look are unbelievable. The rooms restaurants and hotel as a whole are perfection. The hiking trail to Santa Margharita is pretty cool too!
reviews.title: Truly splendido

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night in the Splendido Mare Hotel. We picked the Mare because we prefer the boutique hotel experience and this did not disappoint. We started off to a slightly rocky start with the lack of help with our luggage and the check-in process but the experience was only positive from there on! We were given an upgrade to a balcony room overlooking the harbor. The room lacked nothing! The room temperature was perfect and self regulating-a rarity in Europe! The bathroom had every amenity possible. The water pressure, make-up mirror, extra storage and wonderful products were superb. The attention to detail sets this hotel apart. We enjoyed the piano bar and gorgeous views. We loved the hiking and overall experience of the area. We hope to go back and spend more time! Truly a delight!
reviews.title: Gorgeous Italian experience!
Will not refund deposit even with 6 weeks notice.
reviews.text: Careful when you book. They will not refund your deposit for ANY reason! This was booked in March, 2013. We were to arrive for 1 night on May 5, 2013. We tried to cancel because we found a cheaper rate, but they would not honor the lower rate. We stayed in Camogli (8 miles away) and tried to battle this with American Express, but they couldn't help us. We lost $855. for 1 night at this Hotel. We had been there before, but we will never return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: This was my second time back to this hotel and I wondered if it would be as good as I remembered...it was better! Room 542 is so charming the bathroom is awesome, bedroom is great, there's a small sitting room but the best part of all is climbing up a small ladder out the window onto the rooftop terrace. All of Portofino is your view, and it is so private. The service at this hotel was amazing both times I was here. Very helpful! Room service was great we ate on the terrace every morning and they climbed out the window to set up and clean up, smiling the whole time. They were all very sweet. Laundry service was fantastic and we used the car hire as well. They were also very helpful with local info. This place is awesome and the people are wonderful.
reviews.title: Loooove this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This five-star hotel overlooks the Mediterranean Sea and sits high above Portofino. Amazing views from your room and outstanding service. We attended a wedding where the service was held at the Castle and the reception held at Hotel Splendido. White-glove service all the way. The pool is an enormous infinity pool overlooking the Sea. The food was outstanding and Vladimir on the piano is quite the entertainer. I must say that all 26 people who traveled and stayed at the hotel for the wedding say it was a "once in a lifetime" experience. Everyone should experience Portofino and the Hotel Splendido.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way!
The view!
reviews.text: We spent long weekend there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was good but not more.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was terrific, eating environment was great, very romantic!
reviews.title: SPECTACULAR-Felt like a dream...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from 5 nights in Portofino. The Hotel Splendido is definitely the place to stay in Portofino. We had a lovely room on the 1st floor (in US, would be 2nd floor) with a large terrace with table and chairs overlooking the sea. Our room category was "double deluxe sea view with balcony." I think our room was actually larger than some in the same category by being on the 1st floor, as that floor extended out more and afforded us an extra indoor sitting area. Meals and service were great. The heated swimming pool is very nice, and means you can swim even when it is not particularly hot outside. Antonio serves great drinks, and also sings in the evening in the piano bar. Vladi is the pianist in the evening. We could have done without the guests singing in karaoke style, but many seemed to enjoy that aspect. Just not as much for us. We had the half board package, which meant our breakfasts and dinners were included. You can also go into "town" and eat at the sister property, Splendido Mare.
reviews.title: Beautiful Portofino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel Splendido is a special place - definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Splendido Mare - Unforgettable !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Splendido Mare is described as Splendido's delightful 'little sister' but in my opinion it is more like it's 'all wishes come true' fairy godmother. From the moment I set foot in the hotel, the warm embrace that greeted me was overwhelming and in true Italian style I was welcomed as one of the family. Thank you Johanna. With the fairy godmother at play, I was upgraded to a sea facing room which was beyond anything I could have dreamed up. The luxurious room, equipped with all the comforts fit for royalty, included a welcoming bottle of champagne to be relished with deliciously plump and juicy strawberries, and the bathroom, which is deserving of its own merits, due to its opulence, was equipped with Bulgari shower/bath accessories. Just when I thought that the experience could be alikened to what I imagined only heaven could hold, I was introduced to the view from the balcony. The gentle, soft pink and blue hues that reflected off the water in the Portofino Bay below were made that much more inviting by the beautiful yachts that had the privilege of resting in such a treasured place. Nothing can prepare you for the beauty that is Portofino and nothing can measure up to such a place as the beautiful Splendido Mare. I preferred the Splendido Mare to Splendido on the hill as it was part of the life of the village. Meeting the inhabitants, in particular Mariangela, who is Queen of the Focaccia, and sharing their passion and love for Portofino made me feel more welcome there. The concierge, receptionists and waiters of Splendido Mare were a wealth of information and their passion for the history of the hotel and the village coupled with their extensive knowledge made them a pleasure to speak to and made the experience so much more personal. The Splendido Mare took great care in knowing your likes and dislikes and made it their quest to ensure that your every like was met and your every dislike was never in your vicinity. The extreme joy with which the staff at Splendido Mare do their work is intoxicating and contagious and drew me back to the hotel every night for dinner or after dinner drinks. The evenings there are made that much richer with the masterful skills of the heartwarming Professor Maurizio Moro on the piano and the rich velvet voice of Luca, Maitre D'Hotel, whose skills at preparing fish are also to be admired. The chef at Splendido Mare would leave Michelin rated chefs green with envy and Santo, restaurant manager, ensures that the standards are continually met along with getting to know his patrons tastes. I feel it would not be fair to not mention Angelo, Nino, Mario who also waited on my every need and made every meal at Splendido Mare a cherished event. There are truly no words to describe Splendido Mare. It is truly worth every cent you spend and every person should have that experience at least once in their lives. Thank you so much for making the trip so unforgettable. Ciao - Caterina Loupis
reviews.title: One of the best in the world
The Best Hotel Experience of My Life
reviews.text: Splendido is definitely one of the best. Amazing view of Portofino bay, excellent service, worth every cent that you pay (and you pay ..). We were on our 20 anniversary and enjoyed every moment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic views, exceptional hotel, great staff. Everthing about Splendido is exceptional. I was unfortunately there alone - I will go back one day with my wife. Find a way to go, it's worth it.
reviews.title: One of life's rare gems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to stay last week (it's opening week).I would agree with most of the comments made by previous reviewers.It's very expensive, just in tips I spent over 300euros (we were only there for 4 days!).Was the stay worth the money-most definitely yes.The service standards are very high & nothing was too much for the staff.A final word regarding the pianist.He was brilliant & was very popular.I can understand why he's been the resident pianist for over 20 years. A lovely chap & very entertaining.
reviews.title: It lives up to it's name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During the day we went on some lovely walks using the dedicated footpaths.One day we made it to Rapello circa 5 miles & did the return walk!The area is well is served by a local bus network (catch down at Portofino town).I didn't fancy the coastal road so I didn't use the car during our stay.
reviews.title: The Splendido is still splendid!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed several times in the past but not recently. We returned at the very start of the 2012 season just prior to Easter (which, by the way, is an excellent time to go to beat the crowds). Contrary to some reports, the hotel is still in splendid form. The private and public rooms are immaculate and the entire staff is both friendly and highly competant. The setting, of course, is superb with beautiful gardens and a pool (+ tennis court) overlooking one of the most beautiful tiny ports in the world. Simply charming! Prices are what you would expect from a spectacular hotel-i.e., not for the faint hearted or budget traveler, but every aspect of the hotel is first class.Our only "complaint" would be about the rather overly loud piano player/singer in a "Las Vegas style" spangled jacket who spoiled our enjoyment of some excellent martinis in the bar, but who was obviously enjoyed by some of the other clientele. (Each for his own.) We shall return.
reviews.title: Breathtaking resort on the Italian Riviera!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were unsure if it would be worth it as it can be very expensive in high season, but I have to stay it was worth every penny! Classic Italian charm with modern luxury. The views are stunning and we loved loved loved the walk down to Portofino in the evenings for dinner. It has elegance and charm without being snobby. It absolutely gorgeous!
reviews.title: "Well-seasoned"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Portofino has been delivering excellence for 100 years and it shows. Staying there is effortless..staff is attentive but not in your face, food is excellent and the setting is, well, Portofino!
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon

description: The view from the Hotel Splendido is absolutely breathtaking: you are surrounded by beautiful gardens and can gaze down upon the charming little harbour of Portofino. The hotel has just the right blend of beauty, style, comfort and service. Swim and sunbathe by the beautiful swimming-pool, pamper yourself at the Spa or treat yourself to gourmet meals at La Terrazza restaurant. If you look for unique experiences, enjoy a romantic sunset cruise with champagne on the hotel's private boat or try the olive oil tasting classes on the terrace.
